H0.text: Mary Mallon was effectively imprisoned for life in New York for being an irresponsible immune carrier of what disease. Cholera

H1.text: Mary Mallon was effectively imprisoned for life in New York for being an irresponsible immune carrier of what disease. Dysentery

H2.text: Mary Mallon was effectively imprisoned for life in New York for being an irresponsible immune carrier of what disease. Hepatitis

H3.text: Mary Mallon was effectively imprisoned for life in New York for being an irresponsible immune carrier of what disease. Typhoid

A4.text: Mary Mallon became the first known example of an asymptomatic carrier of an infectious disease, making typhoid fever the first known disease being transmissible through asymptomatic hosts.

A5.text: Ultimately, 51 cases and 3 deaths were suspected to be caused by Mallon.
